Acceptance Criteria - In accordance with NZS 3109. Finished level of formwork shall be within +-10mm of design. The line of the formwork shall be straight with the maximum deviation from a 3m straight edge along the face of 5mm with a cumulative total of all visible gaps of not more than 10mm

3.2.1 - Imported Fill (AP65) and Structural Fill Sources
Acceptance Criteria - Max Dry Density (Standard) and Optimum Water Content
Verifying Document - 1 set for each fill material and source (each 5000m3 thereafter)
Acceptance Criteria - Max Dry Density (Heavy) and Optimum Water Content
Verifying Document - 1 set for each fill material and source (each 5000m3 thereafter)
Acceptance Criteria - Non-woven filtration class 1 and Geotextile strenght class C.
○ Confirm the above grade from the Manufacturer's Certificate of Compliance with IANZ endorsed or equivalent test documents.
Verifying Document - Product data sheet, Docket
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 2.15
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to placement of the geogrid, verification of the grade, length, orientation and layout is required against the drawings.
Verifying Document - Product data sheet, Photos, As-built
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 2.3

Acceptance Criteria - Clearing shall include the complete removal of stumps, trees, logs, scrub and coarse vegetation and disposal by burning, or dumping and burying in accordance with any particular requirements of the contract documents
Verifying Document - Photos, Checklist as per requirements
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (200mm), Section 2.9
Acceptance Criteria - Topsoil shall be removed within the limits of the earthworks. Care shall be taken during the removal to avoid contamination of the topsoil.
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Dimension Inspection, Visual
4.1.3 - Subgrade Suitability Testing - Scala Penetrometer Testing
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 2.18.2
Acceptance Criteria - The Subgrade must be tested by Scala penetrometer or Shear Vane to confrim suitiablity. 3 blows per 100mm.
4.1.4 - Subgrade Proof Rolling and Suitability Inspection
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 2.10 and NZTA F/1, 10.5.1

Acceptance Criteria - The subgrade shall be proof rolled to verify the subgrade stiffness and consistency. "Indents" left in the compacte layer shoiuld be no more than 7mm for bulk fill and 5mm for subgrade fill.
○ The RL and area of proof rolling will be surveyed.
Verifying Document - Proof Rolling Sheet, Photos, Survey area
Frequency - Prior to the placement of any filling, Whole area
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Sections 2.13 & 2.18
Acceptance Criteria - Bulk fill shall be tested by NDM with a minimum Dry Density of 95% MDD
Cohesive soils shall be compacted at OWC (moisture limits are 4% below OWC to 2% above OWC)
Minimum acceptable dry density for AP65 is 2100 kg/m3 , a minimum dry density of 95% must be achieved (moisture limits are 4% below OWC to 2% below OWC)
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 2.15

Acceptance Criteria - All geotextiles shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Acceptance Criteria - Planting and grassing shall be in accordance with NZTA P/39.
This includes, but is not necessarily limited to:
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.3

Acceptance Criteria - New grassed areas shall have a minimum of 200mm depth

New garden areas shall have a minimum depth of 300mm.

Where required top soil areas shall tie into existing levels with a minimum depth of 150mm of topsoil and at a maximum grade of 1V:5H.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.3

Acceptance Criteria - Topsoil shall contain less than 5% by dry weight of solid detritus and debris and stone content shll be less than 10% by dry mass. The topsoil shall not contain any object larger than 30mm in diameter in the largest direction.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.4
Acceptance Criteria - Superphosphate fertilizer shall be applied at 20 grams/m2 at grass seeding.
○ Three weeks after seeding, slow release fertilizer shall be applied at a rate of 15 grams/m2
○ The fertilizer shall be 3-2-1 NPK plus trace elements mix. Hydroseeding is acceptable.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.4
Acceptance Criteria - At least 90% of the ground surface shall be covered with no bare area greater than 30mm diameter.
○ The grass sward shall be maintained at no less than 90% weed free (i.e have less than 10% of it's area in non-specific grasses and weeds).
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.4

Acceptance Criteria - Work shall only be undertaken when the weather is suitable i.e mild, dull and moist, and when the ground is moist and workable. All planting and grassing operations shall be suspended during periods of severe frosts, drought, water logging or persistant drying winds.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.5
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor is to supply and install organic mulch to all garden bed and planted areas. Mulch shall be clean, dry and weed free.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.5
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure mulch is kept a minimum of 50mm clear of plant stems to avoid stem rot.
○ Mulch depth shall be maintained to a minimum consolidated depth of 100mm.
4.2.9 - Mulch to Garden Beds - Surface Height
Standard/Specification - As per project specification, Section 6.5
Acceptance Criteria - The surface of the mulch shall be flush with or no more than 25mm below the surrounding ground surface, kerb, path or other formed surface and shall be even and free of hollows.

3.2.1 - AP65 - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Standard/Specification - TNZ M/3 Notes : 1986 TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 : 1991, NZS 4402 : 1986
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, and California Bearing Ratio.
3.2.2 - AP65 - Production Property Tests and Sampling
Standard/Specification - TNZ M/3 Notes : 1986 TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 : 1991
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fines, Permeability, and Particle Size Distribution.
Frequency - 3 per source initially, then 1/1000m³ (stockpile sample)
3.2.3 - AP65 - Testing for Layer Compaction - MDD
Acceptance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density at optimum water content (OWC).
3.2.4 - AP40 - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, and California Bearing Ratio.
Frequency - 1 per source initially, then 1/1000m³ (stockpile sample)
3.2.5 - AP40 - Production Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine as per M/4 Figure 1, Broken Face Content, and WET Particle Size Distribution Limits and Shape Control.
Frequency - 3 per source initially, then 1/1000m³ (stockpile sample)
3.2.6 - AP40 - Testing for Layer Compaction - MDD
Acceptance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density at optimum water content (OWC).
3.2.7 - Sealing Chip - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Resistance, Weak Particles Test, Skid Resistance, and PSV
Frequency - Before Supply and Every 10,000m3 Thereafter
3.2.8 - Sealing Chip - Production Property Test Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Cleanness, Size and Shape, and PSD for G5 / G6
Acceptance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.
Frequency - One test per grade supplied
Acceptance Criteria - The binder shall have benchmark parameter testing completed complying with the requirements of NZTA Q05.
Acceptance Criteria - General purpose Portland cement, type GP, shall be used unless otherwise specified in the Contract documents.
Acceptance Criteria - As per NZTA M/10 specification
Verifying Document - Mix Design, Production Test report or Volumetric properties
Standard/Specification - Class C as per design spec

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall submit to the Engineer for approval the details of the filter fabric they propose to use at least two weeks prior to commencement of works, including compliance certificates.
Standard/Specification - TENSAR TRIAX TX160 as per desig spec
Acceptance Criteria - The geogrid shall be manufactured in accordance with a management system that complies with BS EN ISO 9001 and BS 14001.
Standard/Specification - Project Specification CVSC Pvmt Type C Detail on Bartley Dwg TD002
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum CBR 3.5% to be achieved failed to achieve the above need to carry with the contingency details as per Project Specification CVSC Pvmt Type C Detail on Bartley Dwg TD002
Frequency - Before starting Subbase layer, whole lot in 20x20 centers

Acceptance Criteria - All geotextiles shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. 
A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Frequency - Each roll out and overlaps
Standard/Specification - Project Specification CVSC Pvmt Type C Detail on Bartley Dwg TD002
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to placement of the geogrid, verification of the grade, length, orientation and layout is required against the drawings.
○ A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Frequency - Each roll out and overlaps
Acceptance Criteria - The uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored thoughout
Acceptance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC.
Verifying Document - Plateau test results confirmance
Acceptance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 95 % of MDD Minimum Value ≥ 92 of MDD
Frequency - 1/10m each layer not exceeding 200mm. If no clear lanes then 1 test per 50m2.
Acceptance Criteria - The Sub-basecourse shall be monitured for Layer thickness. –25 mm +5 mm

Standard/Specification - Contract Specification,
Section 3.5.5 & Appendix F
Verifying Document - Test report, delivered weekly
Frequency - 1 per 10m each traffic lane (alternating wheel paths) or 1 test /50m2 if no clear lane
Acceptance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC.
Verifying Document - Plateau test results confirmance
4.1.10 - Basecourse Pavement Layer Compaction (Pre stabilise Basecourse)
Acceptance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 98 % of MDD Minimum Value ≥ 95 of MDD
Frequency - 1/10m each layer not exceeding 200mm. If no clear lanes then 1 test per 50m2.
Acceptance Criteria - The Sub-basecourse shall be monitured for Layer thickness. –5 mm +15 mm

Acceptance Criteria - Check the temperature (between 5 °C or and 30 ºC), Wind (not exceeds 25km/hr), Rain, Time limitations(Primary compaction within 2 hr and the final trimming compaction within 4 hrs)
Acceptance Criteria - Every 400 m2 complete a Mat test using a 1m2 cancas. The ammount of Stabilising Agent on the canvas shall be within ±0.5 kg/m2 of the specified rate.

Acceptance Criteria - Upon emptying the spreader and bulk tanker, Compare tonnes of Stabilising Agent used (from delivery docket) with measured area. Usagese shall be within ±2.5 % of the specified rate
Verifying Document - Calculation with Dockets and Weights
Frequency - Upon emptying the spreader and bulk tanker

Acceptance Criteria - The water content during compaction shall be in the range of 90% to 100% of the material’s optimum water content. The water content tests taken prior to stabilising and the water consumed per cut shall be recorded in the production plan records.
Verifying Document - NDM Results, delivered weekly

Acceptance Criteria - The actual depth of the cut shall be physically measured at both ends of the stabilising drum at least once every 200 m along the cut length. Maximum variation from the specified depth of cut is –0 mm and +20 mm. Unless specifically allowed in the project specification, the depth of cut shall not intrude into a subgrade layer.

Acceptance Criteria - To ensure complete stabilisation across the full width of the road, longitudinal joints between successive cuts shall overlap by minimum of 200 mm or half the layer thickness, whichever is the greater.

Acceptance Criteria - The exact location of the end of the cut shall be carefully marked. This mark shall coincide with the position of the centre of the mixing drum at the point at which the supply of the stabilising agent ceased. To ensure continuity of the stabilised layer, the next successive cut shall be started 1 m behind this mark.

Acceptance Criteria - At the outset of compaction the contractor shall undertake plateau density tests for the purpose of determining the practicality of both the OWC and the MDD mix design targets, the minimum, and possibly the maximum, number and type of roller passes required to achieve the MDD for the proposed compaction plant and stiffness of lower pavement ‘anvil’ beneath the layer to be compacted.

Acceptance Criteria - The Degree of Compaction for Cement Treated Subbase shall have a Mean Dry Density of ≥ 98 % and a Minimum Dry Density of ≥ 95%. Compaction testing during construction of the stabilised pavement layers shall be carried out in lots.The area of a lot shall not exceed 1000 m2
Standard/Specification - NZTA T/19, Contract Specification, Section 3.6.5, Appendix F
Acceptance Criteria - ITS testing shall be carried out in accordance with NZTA T/19. The maximum time between mixing and compaction shall be 2 hours. The ITS test ranges shall be as follows:
– The Tensile Strength Retained (TSR) shall be no less than 75%
– If results are below the target strengths then notify the Engineer immediately.
Verifying Document - Test Results, delivered weekly

Frequency - 2 ITS (dry) and 2 ITS (soaked) for behind the hoe sampled each day of stabilisation. 

Samples are to be taken from seperate locations.
Standard/Specification - Contract Specification, Section 3.5.5 & Appendix F
Verifying Document - Test report, delivered weekly
Frequency - 1 per 10m each traffic lane (alternating wheel paths) or 1 test /50m2 if no clear lane
Acceptance Criteria - Basecourse where asphalt surfacing with concrete channel
(i) at or close to the lip of channel –5 +5 mm
(ii) at other locations on pavement –15 +5 mm
(iii) at other locations on pavement –5 +15 mm
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse surface finish, as distinct from the surface shape, shall present a tightly consolidated surface when swept.
Standard/Specification - TNZ B/02: 2005 - 12, Contract Specification, Section 3.6.7
Acceptance Criteria - The seal coat shall not be applied unless the water content at each test point of the basecourse layer is such that the degree of saturation (DOS) is less than 70%.
4.3.2 - Benkelman Beaming on Basecouse (on AP40 CTB)
Standard/Specification - Contract Specification, Section 3.5.5 & Appendix F
Verifying Document - Test report, delivered weekly
Frequency - 1 per 10m each traffic lane (alternating wheel paths) or 1 test /50m2 if no clear lane

Acceptance Criteria - The road shall be reasonably dry before the binder is applied, and no spraying with asphaltic binder shall be carried out when the air temperature measured within the confines of the sealing course is below 10oC in the shade.
Verifying Document - Hold point Release, ITP Sign off

Acceptance Criteria - The emulsified asphalt may be sprayed at the temperature at which it is received from the manufacturing plant except that no emulsified asphalt shall be sprayed at a temperature in excess of 90oC or below 20oC.
Acceptance Criteria - All binder sprayed shall be covered with chips across the full sprayed width, apart from necessary longitudinal laps, within five minutes of spraying.
Acceptance Criteria - The Engineer will inspect the sealcoat immediately prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction and after final surplus chip removal is completed.
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall make no repairs without the prior approval of the Engineer for the methods to be used.
4.4.1 - Preparation of Area to be Paved

Acceptance Criteria - The surface on which the paving is to be laid shall be free from standing water, and any loose material, dust, clay or foreign matter shall be removed by sweeping. All fatty and unsuitable patches shall be removed. Depressions and other irregularities shall be patched or corrected.
Acceptance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C,
Verifying Document - Site Notes/ Weather report
4.4.3 - Seal surface check prior to asphalt
Acceptance Criteria - Visual inspection by engineer's representative
Standard/Specification - Minimum Residual Bitumen of 1.2 L/m2 As per project based pavement specification

Acceptance Criteria - Tack coat shall be applied to the cleaned surface prior to placing asphalt. Tack coats shall be applied using a distributor. The use of a hand lance shall be minimised to ensure an even application of the tack coat. Where SMA is to be spread over clean, freshly placed asphalt, the Engineer can direct the Contractor to omit the tack coat.
Verifying Document - Run sheet, QA from Sub
Standard/Specification - NZTA M10 & M27, Contract Specification 3.7.15, Appendix F, Section 10.15
○ Asphalt layers less than or equal to 55mm shall be +/- 5mm from the specified design thickness.
○ The combined thickness of all asphalt layers should not be less than the specified total asphalt depth.
Verifying Document - Run sheet, QA from Sub
Acceptance Criteria - Thickness as per design lift with +/-10mm (AC14)
Acceptance Criteria - No more than 5 mm variation under a 3 m stright edge
Acceptance Criteria - The maximum and minimum air voids for each core shall be +3%/-2% from the mix design air voids.
Verifying Document - Test results, delivered weekly
Acceptance Criteria - Thickness as per design lift with +/-10mm (AC20)
Acceptance Criteria - As per NZTA standard/ design drawings
Verifying Document - ITP sign off/ Photos

Acceptance Criteria - Sieve analysis NZS 4402 Test 4.2.8.2
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Stormwater Swales, 3.1.3)
Acceptance Criteria - Single size angular stone chip no larger than 9.5mm
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Stormwater Swales, 3.1.5)
Acceptance Criteria - The media must consist of material that has:
○ 5% clean organic compost from a consistent source. The source of clean organic material must have been provided to the Engineer for acceptance prior to supply.
○ Locally sourced topsoil (free of weeds or contamination)
○ No obvious seeds, weeds, any contamination and material > 25mm in nominal diameter
○ < or = to 50% coarse sand from a consistent source to improve permeability and structure.
○ < 5% by volume of particles exceeding 4.75mm nominal diameter.
○ Well graded particle size from 0.075mm through to 4.75mm with no gaps in the grading.
○ Compacted hydraulic conductivity of at least 50mm/hr and nort exceeding 400mm/hr based on the ASTM F1815-069 methodology.
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.4.4)
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete pipes must be reinforced concrete rubber ring jointed pipe complying with AS/NZS 4058.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.4.2)
Acceptance Criteria - PVC-U pipes and fittings for gravity stormwater must be plain wall construction rubber ring jointed and must comply with AS/NZS 1254.
○ All PVC pipes must have factory fitted, composite rings; loose Z type rings must not be used.
○ PVC-U pipe diameters shown on the Drawings are the nominal diameters unless shown otherwise. Pipe classes are to be as shown on the Drawings
Verifying Document - Concrete pipes must be reinforced concrete rubber ring jointed pipe complying with AS/NZS 4058.

Standard/Specification - As per project specification
(Pipeline Supply, 2.4.3)
Acceptance Criteria - PE & PP pipe must comply with AS/NZS 5065.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.5.1)

Acceptance Criteria - Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings, manholes (and manhole components) must be circular precast reinforced concrete manholes manufactured in accordance with AS/NZS 4058 with cast in base manufactured to NZ5 3109.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.5.2)

Acceptance Criteria - Manhole lids must be precast reinforced concrete manufactured in accordance with NZS 5109 rated heavy duty (HD60) or HN-H0-72 as specified on the Drawings or as required by the local authority
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.5.3)

Acceptance Criteria - Manhole lids must be precast reinforced concrete manufactured in accordance with NZS 5109 rated heavy duty (HD60) or HN-H0-72 as specified on the Drawings or as required by the local authority
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.6)

Acceptance Criteria - Use precast single or double catchpits manufactured from reinforced concrete complying with NZS 3101 and NZ 3109. Each single catchpit must have minimum internal dimensions of 450 mm by 675 mm.
○ Use grates rated to class D complying with As 3996 with
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.7)

Acceptance Criteria - Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings, subsoil drains must be DN110 perforated corrugated plastic pipe complying with AS 2439.1-2007 Perforated plastics and drainage and effluent pipe and fittings, Part 1: Perforated drainage pipe and associated fittings, and be minimum SN 4
Standard/Specification - As per project specification T-WES 00012, Section 4.8
Acceptance Criteria - Do not change the source of supply of materials without written approval from the Engineer - refer Section 2.1
Verifying Document - Approved list Verification / Datasheet
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - As per project specification refer T-WES 00013, 2.4
Acceptance Criteria - All fittings shall be of the material, grade, diameter and pressure class shown on the Drawings/specifications and be on the approved material list
Verifying Document - Approved list Verification / Datasheet
Standard/Specification - As per project specification refer T-WES 00014, 2.5
Acceptance Criteria - All fittings shall be of the material, grade, diameter and pressure class shown on the Drawings/specifications and be on the approved material list
Verifying Document - Approved list Verification / Datasheet
Standard/Specification - As per project specification refer T-WES 00014, 2.6
Acceptance Criteria - All Joints shall be of the material, grade and size shown on the Drawings/specifications and be on the approved material list
Standard/Specification - As per project specification refer T-WES 00014, 2.7
Acceptance Criteria - All surface boxes and covers over buried valves and hydrants must be rated to AS 3996 Class B (footpaths and non-trafficable areas) or Class D (trafficable areas).
○ Use PVC risers and/or or concrete frames as necessary to provide access to the valves or hydrants.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.8)

Acceptance Criteria - For flexible pipes, well graded processed AP20 complying with AS/NZS 2566.2 section 54.2. Any proposed alternative bedding material must meet the requirements of AS/NZS 2566.2 section 5.4.2.1 note 3 and may only be used if approved by the Engineer in writing.

○ Where low-fines embedment material is specified on the Drawings, the material must be a graded AP20 with none passing the 2.36 mm sieve size (no fines material) that has the consistency and moisture content suitable for placement without segregation. Screened in-situ materials may be used for embedment
○ Pea metal may not be used
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Pipeline Supply, 2.8)

Acceptance Criteria - For concrete pipes, Material with grading limits in accordance with As/NZS 3725 and the CPAA Engineering Guideline Selecting Materials for Bedding Steel Reinforced Concrete Pipe available from the CPAA website.

○ Where low-fines embedment material is specified on the Drawings, the material must be a gradec AP20 with none passing the 2.36 mm sieve size (no fines material) that has the consistency and moisture content suitable for placement without segregation It is expected that screened in-situ materials will be used for embedment. The material used is to have a Compaction Fraction (CF) of 0.1 or less as defined below
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review

Acceptance Criteria - Before construction commences establish the maximum dry density using NZS 4402 Test 4.1.3 New Zealand vibrating hammer compaction test. Submit results to the Engineer one week before importing trench fill material.
Standard/Specification - As per project specification (Minor Concrete Works, 2.1)
Acceptance Criteria - Normal concrete witht the requirements of NZS 3104 and strength shown on the drawings. Where the strength us not shown, use 25 Mpa normal concrete
Acceptance Criteria - Geotextile to be the grade and standards on the drawings and be on the Approved materials list.
○ Non-Woven Filtration Class 1 and Geotextile Strength Class C

Acceptance Criteria - Ensure the excavation is clear of roots, projections, or obstructions. If overexcavation occurs, bring the bottom back to grade using excavated material, lightly compacting it. Do not leave loose soil. Notify the Engineer if the swale contains low-permeability soils; they will assess and advise on additional excavation if needed.
Frequency - Before instal the drainage media
Standard/Specification - As per three water specification Section 3.3.2

Acceptance Criteria - Carefully position drainage media in a clean, excavated area free of contaminants after removing materials. Use the media as embedment around the subsoil pipe, ensuring it is lightly tamped in the bedding zone without mechanical compaction. Avoid placing or lightly compacting drainage media in flooded excavations or saturated in-situ soils.

Standard/Specification - As per three water specification 
Section 3.3.3

Acceptance Criteria - Position subsoil pipes centrally in the drainage media layer per specifications and drawings. Avoid laying pipes in flooded or saturated soils; no filter sleeves for perforated pipes. Install pipes parallel to bedding, avoiding ponded water in the swale. Carefully place a minimum of 50 mm of drainage media around the pipe, using it as embedment material without mechanical compaction.
Standard/Specification - As per three water specification Section 3.3.4

Acceptance Criteria - Place a 400 mm thick layer of uncompacted sand over the Drainage Media, avoiding compaction with construction equipment. Ensure the subsoil drain is undisturbed, and rake the sand for a level finish.

Standard/Specification - As per three water specification 
Section 3.3.5

Acceptance Criteria - Place soil media in a single lift up to 50 mm above the Construction Drawings' finished level for post-construction consolidation. Ensure a smooth, uniform surface, lightly consolidate the soil, and avoid disturbing the subsoil drain. Rectify sediment blinding as directed by the Engineer. Do not exceed 30% moisture content to prevent poor performance. Notify the Engineer for approval; upon acceptance, commence grass sowing within seven days.
Standard/Specification - As per grass sowing mix

Acceptance Criteria - Sow an approved bird-repellent coated grass seed mix at 1 kg/30 m² and fertilize with diammonium phosphate at a minimum rate of 1 kg per 50 m². Aim for a 90% grass strike by the end of the Defects Notification Period, promptly fixing any surface depressions.
Verifying Document - Photo, Docket, Mix design
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Standard/Specification - Double ring infiltrometer Test Method
Acceptance Criteria - Test reslt > 50 mm/hr as per project spec Test to complete as per project's three water specification Section 3.5.1
Verifying Document - Test result, Witness Engineer
Frequency - Two test per stormwater swale
Acceptance Criteria - Subsoil drains shall be constructed to the lines, levels and dimensions shown on the construction drawings and fully comply with the dimesnional and drawing specifications
Verifying Document - Checksheet, Asbuilt and Photo

Acceptance Criteria - The length of open trench shall not exceed the greater of one manhole length or 50m and when offsite this open trench shall be reduced to a maximum length of not more than 10 metres.

Acceptance Criteria - The minimum trench width shall be 300mm wider than the external diameter of the collar of the pipe being laid, providing the haunching metal is compacted under and at the sides of the pipe.
Acceptance Criteria - Complete Scala testing on the trench Subgrade to a depth of 1m every 10m and when the subgrade changes appearance.

Acceptance Criteria - Pipe inverts shall be laid to ±10mm of the design vertical alignment. Pipes shall be individually aligned to grade. Gravity pipes shall not be laid at a negative grade. Pipe alignments shall be positioned horizontally within the greater of 50mm or 5% of the pipe diameter from the location specified.
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm to 95% of MDD.
Frequency - One test every two layers per 50 m
Acceptance Criteria - Structures shall be positioned within 50mm horizontally of the location specified. All structures shall be watertight.
Acceptance Criteria - Complete Scala test on the subgrade underneath each structure to a depth of 1m
Acceptance Criteria - Unless specified otherwise, all catchpits, manholes and other stormwater structures shall be founded on a minimum 75 mm bedding.
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm to 95% of MDD.
Frequency - One test every two layers per manhole

Acceptance Criteria - Drill holes around the intended cut line before removing the section to create pipe penetrations. Ensure that the diameter of the cutout does not exceed 100 mm beyond the outer diameter of the pipe.
Acceptance Criteria - Construct manhole benching and channelling using 25 MPa concrete. Cast and trowel manhole benching to shape, sloping towards the channel at minimum 1:12 with a U2 finish.
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be haunched and surrounded with concrete to a minimum distance of 200mm from the outside of the manhole in accordance with the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe ends shall finish approximately 50mm beyond the inside wall and be plastered with cement mortar or encased in benching concrete in accordance with the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Provide a method statement for controlling water in trenches or dewatering for the Engineers acceptance five days before construction, including:
○ Reasons why the proposed de-watering system has been chosen.
○ Proposed location and details of any well points/spears.
○ Details of back-up power supplies in case there is a power failure.
○ Details of discharging (location(s), volume and flow rate) including environmental controls.
○ A rsk assessment with respect to dewatering affecting adjacent structures.
○ Detrails of how niose standards will be met.
Acceptance Criteria - Pipelines including laterals shall be tested in accordance with one of the following methods as detailed in AS/NZS 2566.2 Section 6.4:
Acceptance Criteria - The Test must be witnessed by the Engineer or their representative. A record of all tests shall be made and forwarded to the Engineer within 24 hours of test completion.
(b) Full description of section of pipeline being tested, including pipe length, pipe diameter, class and manufacture.
(c) Number of sump connections or laterals on the section being tested.
(e) The start time of the test
(f) The pressure at the start time
(g) Time taken to drop pressure by 2 kPa
(h) Minimum and maximum pressure in the test section and water loss over 30 minutes
(i) Whether the pipeline passed the test
(j) The name and signature of the Contractors personnel responsible for the test
(k) The name and signature of the Engineers nominated personnel who witnessed the test

Acceptance Criteria - An ovality test shall be carried out on gravity pipelines in accordance with clause 6.5 of AS/NZS 2566.2 “Buried flexible pipelines – Installation”. The test shall be carried out at least seven days after the pipe surround is laid.

Acceptance Criteria - All completed pipelines (excluding laterals and sump connections) are to be inspected using CCTV after backfilling and leak testing is successfully completed, but prior to final surface restoration.
○ The specific requirements for the CCTV inspection are found within clauses (a) to (f)

Acceptance Criteria - All manholes (new and refurbished) shall be water tested. Manhole watertightness testing must be witnessed by the Engineer or their representative. A record of all tests shall be made and forwarded to the Engineer within 24 hours of test completion.

Acceptance Criteria - Shape the foundation for uniform pipe support and alignment. Alert the Engineer if unsuitable trench floor material and await instructions before proceeding with additional work.
Acceptance Criteria - Refer engineers advise where the foundation fails to meet the design requirments.
Acceptance Criteria - Geotextiles shall fully wrap raft foundations, in accordance with the manufacturer’s specification, where rafts are required.
Acceptance Criteria - Place and compact all filling materials in layers not exceeding 200 mm compacted thickness. For pipe embedment at least 90% of the maximum dry density (MDD)
Frequency - NDM Every 50 m per 200mm of fill
Acceptance Criteria - Lay in straight lines, beginning at the lower end of the line (unless agreed otherwise in writing with the Engineer), and complete each joint before another pipe is laid.
○ Lay all pipe with manufacturing codes and class markings facing upwards.
Acceptance Criteria - Submit the proposed methodology for pipe laying, concrete work, jointing and backfilling to the Engineer and obtain acceptance before starting pipe installation.

Acceptance Criteria - Unreinforced Concrete Thrust Blocks Precast concrete thrust blocks can only be used where approved by the local authority. Arrange for the Engineer to inspect the first completed thrust block.
Verifying Document - Checksheet, concrete test result
Frequency - On the first completed thrust block
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforced Concrete Thrust Walls / Thrust Blocks
○ All thrust wall steel reinforcement must comply with AS/NZS 4671. Have the Engineer inspect the thrust wall reinforcing and puddle pipe arrangement prior to pouring concrete.
Verifying Document - Checksheet, concrete test result
Frequency - for each set of blocks pouring
Acceptance Criteria - Complete the flange bolting procedure as per project spec and check sheet
○ Have the Engineer witness the first flanged joint completed on the PE 100 pipeline
Frequency - First flanged joint completed on the PE 100 pipeline
Acceptance Criteria - AP65 backfill shall be compacted in 200mm loose layers to at least 95% of the maximum dry density (MDD) every 50m.
Frequency - NDM Every 50 m per 200mm of fill
Acceptance Criteria - Complete the pressure test in accordance with the project specification and the check sheet for pressure test.
○ The system test Pressure (STP) is 1,000 kPa.
Acceptance Criteria - Before commencing any pressure acceptance test:
○ Give the Engineer at least two working days notice.

○ Provide the Engineer with a detailed work method statement (WMS) with details of how the pressure testing will be carried out at least 10 working days prior to the test, including but not limited to:
○ Proposed equipment to be used, including pump/s, water meters, logging pressure gauge/s, check pressure gauge/s
○ Proposed fill rate, noting the bulk fill must not be greater than the discharge capacity of any air valves and any local authority constraints relating to the supply of water
○ Calibration certificates for meters and pressure gauges
○ Details of qualified personnel who will be carrying out the tests
○ Source/s of water proposed to be used
○ Location of the pressure test rig and the proposed test pressure at that location if the elevation of the test rig is higher than the lowest part of the test section
○ The test lengths proposed that will ensure that no pipes are over pressurised or inadequately tested
○ Health and safety risks and mitigation measures

Acceptance Criteria - A resolution with a remaining free available chlorine (FAC) level ranging from 15 to 20 mg/L (ppm). By the conclusion of the disinfection period, the water expelled from the pipelines should retain a minimum FAC concentration of 5 mg/L.
Prepare to submit a WMS for disinfection of potable water pipelines to the Engineer for acceptance before commencing disinfection work. The WMS must include (at least) details of:
○ Swabbing all potable water pipes, valves, and other fittings (> DN 63)
○ How the disinfection solution will be introduced with the initial fill water for pressure acceptance testing, if done, Note that this will be at the Contractors risk

○ How the disinfection solution will be prepared and delivered reliably into the pipeline. Include calculations of dosing and flow rates, strength of the proposed liquid or powered form of hypochlorite as well as methods for checking that the required FAC is being achieved
○ How it is proposed to ensure that all watermains, service pipes, valves and fittings will receive nthe disinfection solution
○ How measurement of the FAC during and at the end of the disinfection process will be achieved to ensure that the system has been fully disinfected
○ How the disinfection solution is to be disposed of safely at the end
○ Identified health and safety risks and proposed mitigation measures

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall open the front outside hose tap, if available, before the supply is reinstated to any premises. Wherever possible, the owner shall be notified prior to this work.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Upon completion of works

Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Mix design for each mix comply with the requirements of the Project Specification

Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcing bars and mesh shall comply with AS/NZS4671:2001.
3.3 Receiving Materials/Parts - Shoulder Widening and Sealing
3.3.1 - AP65 - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Standard/Specification - TNZ M/3 Notes : 1986 TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 : 1991, NZS 4402 : 1986
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, and California Bearing Ratio.
3.3.2 - AP65 - Production Property Tests and Sampling
Standard/Specification - TNZ M/3 Notes : 1986 TNZ M/4: 2006, NZS 4407 : 1991
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fines, Permeability, and Particle Size Distribution.
3.3.3 - AP65 - Testing for Layer Compaction - MDD
Acceptance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density at optimum water content (OWC).
3.3.4 - AP40 - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, and California Bearing Ratio.
3.3.5 - AP40 - Production Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine as per M/4 Figure 1, Broken Face Content, and WET Particle Size Distribution Limits and Shape Control.
3.3.6 - AP40 - Testing for Layer Compaction - MDD
Acceptance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density at optimum water content (OWC).
3.3.7 - Sealing Chip - Source Property Tests and Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Resistance, Weak Particles Test, Skid Resistance, and PSV
Frequency - Before Supply and Every 10,000m3 Thereafter
3.3.8 - Sealing Chip - Production Property Test Sampling
Acceptance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Cleanness, Size and Shape, and PSD for G5 / G6
Acceptance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.
Frequency - One test per grade supplied
Acceptance Criteria - The binder shall have benchmark parameter testing completed complying with the requirements of NZTA Q05.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Mix design for each mix comply with the requirements of the Project Specification
Verifying Document - Concrete supplier mix designs
Frequency - Submitted to Client Engineer for approval before construction
4.1 VMS Foundation with Plinth and cabinet pad - Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Proposed location of construction to be staked out to the engineer for review prior to construction
Frequency - Prior to each foundation build
Acceptance Criteria - Compaction shall achieve a minimum Clegg Impact Value (CIV) of 20 on the first layer and 25 on subsequent layers
Verifying Document - Test reults, Location of Test
4.1.3 - Reinforcement and Hold Down Bolt Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Handling, Fabrication, Placing and Fixing shall be inspected prior to pouring concrete.
Frequency - Prior to each foundation pour
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual Inspection, Dimensional Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Compliant with the construction drawings
Frequency - Prior to each foundation pour
Acceptance Criteria - Pouring of any concrete must be inspected by the Engineer prior to further work being carried out in the area.
Frequency - Prior to each foundation pour

Acceptance Criteria - The delivery docket of each batch delivered certifying the mix designation, cement type, specified strength, slump, date, mixing time, water added during batching and maximum aggregate size.
Acceptance Criteria - One specimen from each pour shall be tested at 28 days.
Acceptance Criteria - Following the concrete pour, the concrete shall be inspected for Size, Shape, Features, inserts, reliefs, and Finish against the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Repair of defective concrete finish other than that due to minor porosity of the surface shall be carried out only when approved by the Engineer.
Acceptance Criteria - The Dimensional tolerances, uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored thoughout
Standard/Specification - Design Specification, Appendix E, Section 2.1.4
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement sholder widening treatment will be confirmed with Engineer on site
Acceptance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 95 % of MDD Minimum Value ≥ 92 of MDD
Acceptance Criteria - The Sub-basecourse shall be monitured for Layer thickness. –25 mm +5 mm
Acceptance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 98 % of MDD Minimum Value ≥ 95 of MDD

Acceptance Criteria - The Sub-basecourse shall be monitured for Layer thickness.
–5 mm +15 mm

Acceptance Criteria - The standard of smoothness shall be such that there is no point in the surface that varies more than 10 mm from a 3 m straight edge placed on the road and any deviation from the straight edge is gradual..
Verifying Document - Survey / Straight edge Report
Frequency - 1/20m Full width prior to sealing
Acceptance Criteria - The basecourse surface finish, as distinct from the surface shape, shall present a tightly consolidated surface when swept.
Acceptance Criteria - The seal coat shall not be applied unless the water content at each test point of the basecourse layer is such that the degree of saturation (DOS) is less than 80%.

Acceptance Criteria - The road shall be reasonably dry before the binder is applied, and no spraying with asphaltic binder shall be carried out when the air temperature measured within the confines of the sealing course is below 10oC in the shade. The Engineer shall be given the opportunity to inspect the site.
Verifying Document - Hold point Release, ITP Sign off

Acceptance Criteria - The emulsified asphalt may be sprayed at the temperature at which it is received from the manufacturing plant except that no emulsified asphalt shall be sprayed at a temperature in excess of 90oC or below 20oC.
Acceptance Criteria - All binder sprayed shall be covered with chips across the full sprayed width, apart from necessary longitudinal laps, within five minutes of spraying.
Acceptance Criteria - The Engineer will inspect the sealcoat immediately prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction and after final surplus chip removal is completed.
Frequency - Prior to TM Removal and After Final Sweeping
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall make no repairs without the prior approval of the Engineer for the methods to be used.
Standard/Specification - Design Specification, Appendix E, Section 2.1.3
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor will set out the guardrail location with the Engineer on site.
Acceptance Criteria - To complete the check list along with the guard rail installer after the construction
